src:
Ръководството на Реал иска Зидан да уреди отношенията си с Бейл
02 Nov 2019, 14:58 by Sportlive.bg
Ръководството на Реал Мадрид не е доволно от обтегнатите отношения между треньора Зинедин Зидан и крилото Гарет Бейл. Затова шефовете искат двамата да намерят общ език и да не са в негласен конфликт, съобщава "ESPN".
Според изданието, за клуба уелсецът все още е един от основните играчи. Ръководството иска Зидан да извлече максимума от крилото, тъй като интересите на отбора са над личните разногласия.
През сезона дотук Бейл изигра 7 мача за испанския гранд, в които вкара 2 гола и направи 2 асистенции. Наскоро се появи информация, че преди мача с ПСЖ уелсецът е отказал да държи флага на Реал Мадрид. По време на мача с Леганес пък той е напуснал стадиона 8 минути преди края на редовното време. А защо Зидан се чувства предаден от Бейл вижте в този материал.

Още по темата
text:
Government released new map of Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh, Aksai China also included in Ladakh
02 Nov 2019, 14:18 by correspondent, New Delhi
After making Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh a Union Territory, the Government of India has also released new maps of both Union Territories. Important that these maps also include Muzaffarabad in the Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir. Also, the union territory of Ladakh has been shown to include Aksai China. The government believes that these maps depict the real situation.
After the abolition of Section 370, Jammu and Kashmir and Ladakh were declared to be Union Territories on 5 August 2019 and on 31 October 2019, both these places have been duly made Union Territories. A new Lt. Governor has also been posted at both the places. According to the new map released by the government, the new Ladakh Union Territory has two districts - Kargil and Leh and the rest of the former Jammu and Kashmir State is in the new Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir.



The erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir state in 1947 consisted of 14 districts of Kathua, Jammu, Udhampur, Reasi, Anantnag, Baramulla, Poonch, Mirpur, Muzaffarabad, Leh and Ladakh, Gilgit, Gilgit Wazarat, Chilhas and Tribal Territory. By 2019, the state government of the erstwhile Jammu and Kashmir had reorganized the areas of these 14 districts into 28 districts. The new districts are named Kupwara, Bandipora, Ganderbal, Srinagar, Budgam, Pulwama, Shopian, Kulgam, Rajouri, Ramban, Doda, Kishtwar, Samba and Kargil.
Out of these, Kargil district was carved out of the area of Leh and Ladakh district. The President ordered the Jammu and Kashmir Reorganization Second Order, 2019, to become the Leh district of the new Ladakh Union Territory, after becoming the Kargil district, in 1947 in the Leh and the remaining areas of the Ladakh district of the 1947 Gilgit, Gilgit Wazarat, Chilhas and Tribal Territory districts. Areas defined as inclusive. On this basis, new maps were prepared by Survey General of India depicting these two new Union Territories in the new Union Territory of Union of India and Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir, created on 31 October 2019. These have now been duly released by the government.
